alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Harrison; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison, west central Clark, western Floyd, Washington and northwestern Meade Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Bedford to 13 miles northeast of Tell City. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Washington, western Floyd, west central Clark, Harrison Counties in south central Indiana and northwestern Meade Counties in north central Kentucky, including the following locations... Crandall, Campbellsburg, Smedley, Shorts Corner, Bradford, Livonia, Fairdale, Central, Titus and Rosebud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
